dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: I'm wearing a black hoodie, black pants. You definitely have more style than me today. So in chess, people have style, too. What's your playing style?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: I wanna say quite aggressive. Like I really wanna win the game fast.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: So as we move up the levels today, we wanna start introducing slightly more advanced terms. One of them is called initiative, but what exactly does that mean to you?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: So like if you're in a battle, you win a certain like spot, right? A really important spot. That gives you initiative. When you get something, right, that you want, then it can start building up. It can start building up to be better and better and bigger and bigger.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: When you find a target and you have a way to create threats, attacks against that target, against that goal, but you do it without sacrificing your resources, right? So you can imagine two boxers, right? One is being pushed into a corner. He could still win, he could totally still win, but for now, one side is definitely the aggressor.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: And has the initiative.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Exactly, has the initiative. You're a tactical aggressive player. You're always looking for the initiative. Me, too. Why don't we play a blitz game? Good luck.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Good luck. Okay. Okay.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: That's not the opening I remember you playing.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: We've played in the park, we've played online. Wonder how many games we've played against each other.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: We've played, I think, probably like, including over the board and online, maybe like nine, 10 games. Okay, so we have like, just like a regular Fiancetto. Let's see.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: This is not the Tani I remember.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: It's quite slow.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: It's a very solid, you know, steady approach. There's nothing wrong with it. Okay. Very balanced.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Let's see.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Actually, I had this chess opening really recently, and I lost that game, and it was very painful and very sad.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: You've have like black has more space.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Would you say black has more initiative? Not yet.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Not yet, but considering the way I said it, it's like you follow up with something. So you just attacked me with that, and I move back. So you kind of, you have the initiative.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: The tough thing about chess is you can have a good position, but you actually have to move pieces. You know, like a piece of art, you just say, Oh, it's done.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: So chess is different from art.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Chess is different from art. Let's go here. I wanna go here. Okay, let's go here. Okay.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Let's see. I'll go here just in case.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: I don't know. Okay, I'm just gonna like take some more space from you.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: This is quite like a, just a,

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: just a position.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: You know what? We've been talking about initiative. I think I just gotta go for it. I just gotta like sort of of push all my pawns.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: So that could be good. That can be bad. I have to deal with it at some point.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: No, you don't. Wow!

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Just in case because I feel like my position is just like a fortress. So it feels like I can do moves like rook H1. Doesn't help my position if you don't attack, but think it's just good to be just steady.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: I'm stunned. Okay, you know what? I'm gonna go bring more pieces to help.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: More pieces to help. Okay. Good.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: How are you just ignoring all my, my whole squad is over there.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Don't wanna take space.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Wow. I mean, I gotta go for it, right? I feel like

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: You have to. Okay.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: I really feel like this is a nice example of black has an initiative.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yeah, black definitely has an initiative.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Black has an initiative. But can black capitalize on this initiative? I don't know. The problem with having a position like this is you feel a lot of pressure to do something.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: If I was black, I want to end the game like right now.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: You wanna end the game right now?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yeah. Okay, let's see. What can I do? Okay, I'll do that. Okay, try and roll up the sleeves, okay.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's the chess player's sign of focus, just- Yeah, when you roll up the sleeves. I guess I have to defend my pawn. I mean, don't really want to, but fine.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Now I'll be annoying to you. Take as much pieces off, and I will take back-

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Would've been nice if you didn't, but. Okay, now maybe we go up.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: And I'll take that pawn.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: That was all part of the plan. It was a very greedy move of you.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: All right, let's see, here.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Now I'll take a pawn.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Oh! All right, let's see. What? [whimpers] I'm scared. Okay, I can do that.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Can do that.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: The board looks different in this building.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Are you up a pawn? No.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Six, six each. We good.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Um, blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Aha!

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: That king of yours, just saying. Just saying that, king of yours.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Come back.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Come back. I'll go forward.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Ah!

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Ooh!

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Ooh.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: It's a block with my rook. This is the Tani game in the tournament all over again. No! [Levy mumbles] [both cry out] I almost lost on time.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yeah, I have no idea what to do.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Me too, by the way.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Ah! But then that.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Is you a rook trapped but like I can't actually take it? That's so weird! Check.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Wait, what? [laughs] Okay.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Oh, I like having more time. That's nice.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Think I'll take those pawns.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Oh, can I like go eat the other pawns? No, I can't.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Ee!

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Ah.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Keep going.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Whoa.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yes, keep going.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: No, I can stop you.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: No, you can't. I mean, yes you can. Can you? Wait, can you? Ah! Okay.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Oh my gosh. No.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: My bishop. Nice game.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: All right, good game.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Oh, that was crazy.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Ah!
